common_issues.description: Users report slow performance, unexpected behavior, and bugs in PiecesOS, particularly with LTM and specific hardware configurations. Proposed solutions include rebooting, waiting for updates, and providing detailed bug reports for investigation by the Pieces team.

"Secret Message" Example doesn't work properly
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When using LTM-2 to test the secret message example:
https://pieces.app/magic-moments/ltm

I got a strange response from the LLM:
Claude 3.5:
First Try:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1962a3e4-8b02-4d3f-bc8c-4bdd72c80aa6)
2. try: (waited longer on the website)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd71c5c1-d5d5-4449-acd5-e070fb244fa9)

Gemini 2.0 Flash did fail completely:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/50735f7a-28a1-4563-b490-e10c271eca23)
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Users are experiencing an issue where PiecesOS is running in "basic mode due to device constraints".
* This issue prevents users from accessing features like vector support and the Workstream Activity view.
* The issue appears to be related to specific hardware configurations, including M3 Macs.
* Rebooting PiecesOS temporarily resolves the issue.

**Problems identified:**

* "Basic mode" functionality is not clearly documented.
* The trigger for entering "basic mode" is not well-defined.
* Users are unable to access features due to the mode switch.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* A fix for the issue is planned for the next PiecesOS version.
* Rebooting PiecesOS is a temporary workaround.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is being addressed in the next PiecesOS release.
* Users can use the workaround until the fix is deployed.

**Additional notes:**

* The "unknown origin" element in the telemetry browser is related to a previous installation of PiecesOS.
* Contact @mark-at-pieces for further information or clarification.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**The Bug**
The chat assistant will respond claiming that it's working on a solution and will get back to you at a later date. 

**Expected Behaviour**
Get an actionable response with some suggested action/code.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

This has happened in three different conversations. I first noticed the behaviour this month, so not before updates preceding March. I promise I'm not trying to be lazy on this one, it's difficult to offer reproduction steps.

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.

**Key Points:**

* User seantiz encountered a bug where files were not loaded into the context despite 11 requests and responses.
* The bug was not reproducible on demand.

**Problems:**

* Files are not loaded into the context, leading to incomplete information in the responses.
* The cause of the bug is unknown, making it difficult to fix.

**Solutions:**

* User was offered resources to potentially troubleshoot the issue.
* The issue was triaged and routed to the appropriate team for further investigation.

**Current Status:**

* The issue remains unresolved.

**Outcome:**

* Currently unknown.

related_issues.title: Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
related_issues.text:
Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Current

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.
## GitHub Issue Summary: Slow LTM Performance

**Key Points:**

* User @bpluly reported slow performance with Long Term Memory (LTM) on their PC.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the relevant Pieces team member.

**Problems Identified:**

* LTM performance is slow, even after updating to LTM-2.
* Possible connection to other issues reported by users.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Related issues were suggested for reference:
    - Long Term Memory slowing down PC (https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/650)
    - PiecesOS launch failure (https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/624)
    - Slow PiecesOS boot-up (https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/613)
* Resources for self-help were provided:
    - Existing Issues: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues
    - Documentation: https://docs.pieces.app
    - YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/@getpieces

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is being investigated by the Pieces team.
* A follow-up is expected within 24 hours.

**Note:** This summary is based on the information provided in the GitHub issue conversation up to March 14, 2025.

related_issues.title: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors
related_issues.text: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors ### Software Web Extension ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.0.3 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. It appears the browser extension is sniffing a bunch of local ports - starting with 1000. This is a bit concerning, and a little invasive, but I do have the Pieces OS running, and it does finally get a response at a high port. This fills my devtools console tab, degrading my development experience by clouding errors I'm looking for in my own app. For a product designed to enhance my development experience I'm marking this as a bug. ## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary: **Key Points Raised:** * Updates to Pieces OS made port designation for the OS dynamic. * This caused Pieces OS API checks to fail on inactive ports and spam the dev tool. * While privacy wasn't compromised, it created a nuisance for developers. **Problems Identified:** * Failed API checks flooded the dev console with unnecessary errors. * This hampered real-time debugging and error identification. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * Initially, a fix was planned for the extension patch update. * Later investigation revealed a Chrome bug causing the issue. * A workaround was suggested to hide network messages in dev console settings. * Ultimately, the issue was fixed in the recent web extension update (v4.0.4). **Current Status/Outcome:** * The issue is resolved with the latest web extension update. * Users are advised to download version 4.0.4 for a clean dev console experience.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Installation and Update Issues
common_issues.description: Users report problems with Pieces OS installation, updates, and personal domain backup. Issues include failure to install in custom locations, update failures with error messages, and difficulties restoring from outdated backups. Solutions involve checking antivirus settings, updating the app installer, and contacting support for personalized assistance.

related_issues.text:
Personal Domain backup

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I want to sync this PC to another PC，but i cann't backup the lastest data.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bfb4fb14-5e7f-45c7-828f-5f77f550453a)

this is another PC

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3c2d880e-a1b2-40c1-82b1-9935bffbf8fb)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key points raised:**

* laborer123 is unable to register a personal domain on a new computer after copying the folders `com.pieces.os` and `com.pieces.pfd`.
* laborer123 also wants to back up their current computer using a personal domain and restore it to a new computer, but the existing backup is outdated.

**Problems identified:**

* The personal domain laborer123 is trying to register is already taken.
* The existing backup is outdated and may not accurately reflect the current state of the computer.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark, a Pieces team member, suggests laborer123 try registering a different personal domain to verify if the functionality is working properly.
* For the backup issue, Mark explains that restoring a backup will overwrite all local data with the cloud-based backup. He provides instructions on how to initiate a restore and includes a screenshot of the button to click.
* Mark also offers to provide further assistance if laborer123 encounters any difficulties with restoring or registering a personal domain.

**Current status/outcome:**

* It is unclear whether laborer123 attempted to register a different personal domain or restore their computer using the existing backup. 


**Additional information:**

* Laborer123 expresses their desire to directly back up their current computer using the personal domain and create a new one. However, it is unclear whether this is possible or recommended. 

**Further action needed:**

* If laborer123 continues to experience difficulties, they should contact Mark or another Pieces team member for further assistance.
* It would be beneficial to clarify whether laborer123 can directly back up their current computer using the personal domain and create a new one.

Installation doesn't follow the System Apps default location
### Checked for Existing Issues?

### Software

### Your Pieces OS Version

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

There's no opportunity for the User to choose where the Pieces OS is installed or where any data that's collected is stored. From Windows 10 onwards there is a system feature to set where new content is to be stored by default. This is in Settings/System/Storage.

You can set where new Apps will be installed, new documents are stored, Music, etc.

Once this is set I would expect a current application to follow the default installation setting rather than hardcode it for the Boot drive.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS Update fails
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS Update fails
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The notification popped up saying an update was available so I clicked Update and a few seconds later got this message box:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b14dc8ab-632a-4095-b45b-7bbaba3c70ce)

This is on a very fresh Windows 11 installation.
## GitHub Issue Summary:

**Issue:** PiecesOS unable to launch on Windows

**Key Points:**

* The issue occurs on Windows using the App Installer technology.
* Users receive an error message mentioning a "trojan detected" issue.
* Certain antivirus software, like Kaspersky, may block PiecesOS.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS fails to launch.
* Users perceive the software as a potential security threat due to the "trojan detected" message.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Update App Installer through the Microsoft Store.
* Configure antivirus software to allow PiecesOS processes.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue persists for some users even after updating App Installer.
* Users are advised to allow PiecesOS in their antivirus software.
* The development team is likely investigating the "trojan detected" issue.

**Additional Information:**

* The issue has been reported by multiple users.
* Similar issues have been reported in the past.
* Resources are available for troubleshooting and support.

related_issues.title: Pieces Visual Studio 2022 extension conflict with SQL Server Object Explorer
related_issues.text:
Pieces Visual Studio 2022 extension conflict with SQL Server Object Explorer
### Checked for Existing Issues?

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

With Pieces Extension installed in Visual studio 2022, SQL database field is not editable (not clickable?)

Reproduce: 
- Connect to any SQL server with some table, choose a table and right click -> View Data
- Try edit the database's table field (the field will be unable to focus, so unable to edit)

* SQL database is editable again after disable pieces extension and restart VS.
* Try turn off everything in the extension's UserPreference did not work.
* While you can not edit a field, but delete a row is possible (so maybe some UI conflict?)

Here are some picture

Without the extension: the edit cursor shown up when click on field
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c45dbafe-29c7-4acd-9827-b34cd0cd76f7)

With the extension: the edit cursor did not show up. Clicking just selected the field.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8f430ff6-18f8-41fe-a58e-42ebbeec3be2)
## GitHub Issue Summary 

**Key points raised:**

* User @hikineet98 reported an issue where the cursor disappears after tabbing away from a cell in a script file opened in the Tool Window.
* The issue seems specific to Visual Studio plugin usage.

**Problems identified:**

* The cause of the disappearing cursor remains unclear.
* Conflict between Tool Window and Pieces for Visual Studio plugin is suspected.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Investigating the conflict between Tool Window and the plugin.

**Current status/outcome:**

* No confirmed solution is currently implemented.
* Investigation is ongoing.
